featured.text: Most of us are comfortable with eye contact lasting a few seconds.
Initial contact is made via e-mail, with subsequent communication usually by phone.
It comes from direct human contact with birds infected with the virus.
A lot of ancient civilizations, __(37)__ the Egyptians, Hindus, Greeks, and Mayans, have left writings and __(38)__ which indicate contacts with superior beings “from the stars.”

other.text: Without much contact with the outside world for many years, John found many technological inventions _____ to him.
But eye contact which persists longer than that can make us nervous.
Moreover, bugs that do come in contact with the mist may be resistant to the pesticide.
The result is an unfortunate tendency for people making initial contact—in a job interview, for example—to stare fixedly at the other individual.
Most people feel uneasy to have eye contact for over a few seconds.
Which advertisement does not need direct contact by making telephone calls? (Write down the letter representing the advertisement.)
Which of the following is NOT discussed in the passage? (A) Facial expressions. (B) Physical contact.

definition.zh_def: 接觸，聯繫或交往的行為或狀態。
definition.en_def: The act or state of communicating or being in touch with someone.
definition.example: Please make sure to contact me if you need any assistance.
